deck.name: Programming Concepts
deck.description: Fundamental programming and computer science concepts

cards.front: What is the time complexity of binary search?
Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In, First Out)?
Which data structure uses FIFO (First In, First Out)?
The four pillars of OOP are: Encapsulation, Inheritance, {{Polymorphism}}, and Abstraction
What is the difference between == and === in JavaScript?
cards.back: == compares values with type coercion, === compares values and types strictly

cards.front: Which are valid HTTP methods? (Select all)
In Git, to create a new branch use: git {{checkout}} -b branch-name (or git switch -c)
What is the purpose of a foreign key in a database?
cards.back: To create a link between two tables by referencing the primary key of another table

cards.front: What is the worst-case time complexity of quicksort?
What is a closure in programming?
cards.back: A function that has access to variables from its outer scope even after the outer function has returned
